title: Ukraine conflict: Russian soldiers seen shooting dead unarmed civilians
description: The incident, captured on video seen by the BBC, is being investigated as a suspected war crime.

title: North Korea announces first death from Covid-19
description: A day after confirming its first cases, state media reports thousands are suffering fever symptoms.

title: Spain plans menstrual leave in new law for those with severe pain
description: Spain could become the first European country with menstrual pain leave under a proposed law.

title: Eurovision 2022: Ireland's Brooke fails to qualify for the final
description: Ireland go home after Thursday's semi-final, despite a warm reception for Derry girl Brooke Scullion.

title: Couple in India sue son for not giving them a grandchild
description: The Indian parents say they used up their savings raising their son and paying for his wedding.

title: Rwandan genocide fugitive Protais Mpiranya confirmed dead
description: Protais Mpiranya led the presidential guard that killed the then-PM and 10 Belgian peacekeepers.

title: Finland Nato: Russia threatens to retaliate over membership move
description: Finland's leaders say they want the country to apply for membership of the alliance "without delay".

title: Shireen Abu Aqla: Palestinians to refer journalist's killing to ICC
description: Shireen Abu Aqla was shot dead while covering a raid by Israeli forces in the occupied West Bank.

title: Coastal fire: California mansions burn as wildfires spread
description: Across North America, wildfire crews are gearing up for a particularly difficult season.

title: Platinum Jubilee: Lemon and amaretti trifle to be official pudding
description: Jemma Melvin's creation is inspired by a lemon posset served at the Queen's wedding to Prince Philip.

title: Sri Lanka crisis: How war heroes became villains
description: The Rajapaksa brothers, hailed by many as heroes for winning the civil war, are now reviled as leaders.

title: Afghanistan pupils in fear after spate of Islamic State attacks
description: A spate of Islamic State attacks have left Afghan students in fear and test Taliban security claims.

title: Eurovision 2022: The anthem for Ukraine born in a war zone
description: The BBC joined Ukraine's Kalush Orchestra as they prepared for the contest amid the rubble of the city of Irpin.

title: LPG price: Millions hit hard as cooking gas prices soar in India
description: Many households in rural areas are forced to rely on wood for cooking as gas has become unaffordable.

title: Ukraine crisis: Could India cut its defence ties with Russia?
description: India has been under pressure to distance itself from Russia over Ukraine, including reducing defence ties.

title: The long struggle to return Cambodia's looted treasures
description: The east Asian country claims the V&A and British Museum both hold stolen antiquities.

title: Ukraine war: Snake Island and battle for control in Black Sea
description: This rocky outcrop has been fiercely contested for weeks and has vital strategic importance.

title: Gambling worry as India firms bet big on online games
description: The industry says online gaming involves skill but critics say it is gambling, which is illegal in India.

title: Sri Lanka protests: Why rioters attacked a museum in Sri Lanka
description: A museum dedicated to the country's ruling family is trashed by anti-government protesters.

title: Tom Hiddleston: Why we all need monsters and myths
description: The Loki star on his thought-provoking role as a Victorian pastor in TV series The Essex Serpent.

title: Ipob: Nigerian 'media warriors' call for killings on social media over Biafra
description: The BBC investigates a network of Nigerian separatists outside the country urging violence online.

title: The black evangelical women who'll decide who governs Brazil
description: Evangelical Christian women of colour were kingmakers in Brazil's last presidential election and look set to be so again.

title: The Ukrainian refugee schoolgirl learning fast in the UK
description: Ukrainian refugee Marharyta, nine, is learning English as she waits to start school in Manchester.

title: Ukraine: The BBC has seen evidence of possible war crimes committed by Russian soldiers
description: The BBC has obtained CCTV footage of the killing of two civilians in cold blood by Russian soldiers that is now being investigated by prosecutors as a suspected war crime.

title: We're ready to consider Nato membership - Finland's foreign minister
description: Foreign Minister Pekka Haavisto tells the BBC that that he wants Finland to join Nato as soon as possible.

title: Air traffic controller on helping passenger land plane after pilot fell ill
description: Robert Morgan talked passenger Darren Harrison through landing a plane after the pilot fell ill.

title: Passers-by in Florida rush to stop moving car with ill driver
description: The car is seen drifting towards traffic before strangers intervened on a busy road in Florida.

title: Joly Germine: Haitian gang leader indicted over missionary abductions
description: Joly Germine allegedly directed the kidnappings of 17 Christian missionaries from a Haitian prison.
